intro: Petalidium huillense, commonly known as the Huillén petalidium, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of southern Peru. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing adaptations to extreme conditions. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, which helps reduce water loss. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
